message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique and valuable product. I believe it's worth a lot to you, but I'm willing to start the conversation at a price of $180. Would you like to make an offer or accept this price?
I'm interested in the product, but $180 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $120 for it. Can you consider my offer?
I understand you're interested in the product, Bob, but $120 is below my minimum. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll counteroffer at $150. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $150 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $130 for the product. Can you consider my offer?
I can see you're really interested in the product, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to make a profit. I'll counteroffer at $145. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your willingness to make a concession, but $145 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $135 for the product. Can you consider my offer?
I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to make a profit. I'll counteroffer at $140. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your willingness to make another concession, but $140 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $130 for the product. Can you consider my offer?
I can see you're really close to your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to make a profit. I'll counteroffer at $138. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your willingness to make one more concession, but $138 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $128 for the product. Can you consider my offer?
